# Why This Matters

**A few years ago, I led a river trip with my family on the Potomac.** 

What started as a peaceful paddle turned dangerous when water levels rose unexpectedly. We made decisions based only on current conditions—no forecast, no historical context. 

**A rescue team had to extract us from Class III rapids.** That experience changed everything.

*This system prevents others from facing the same risk.*

---

# Business Impact: Before vs After

```{r impact-comparison, fig.width=12, fig.height=6, fig.cap="Figure 3. Projected business impact comparison before and after predictive safety system implementation. Values based on regional rescue data analysis and tourism industry projections (Bubulka, 2025)."}
# Create before/after comparison chart
impact_data <- data.frame(
  scenario = rep(c("WITHOUT System", "WITH System"), each = 3),
  metric = rep(c("Rescues/Year", "Response Time (min)", "Tourism Confidence"), 2),
  value = c(58, 45, 0, 44, 30, 20),
  improvement = c("", "", "", "✓ 24% Reduction", "✓ 33% Faster", "✓ 20% Increase")
)

ggplot(impact_data, aes(x = metric, y = value, fill = scenario)) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge", width = 0.7) +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(value, ifelse(improvement != "", paste0("\n", improvement), ""))), 
            position = position_dodge(width = 0.7), vjust = -0.3, size = 4, fontface = "bold") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("WITHOUT System" = "#e74c3c", "WITH System" = "#27ae60")) +
  labs(title = "Business Impact: Before vs After Implementation",
       x = "", y = "Value", fill = "") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
        legend.position = "bottom",
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 0, hjust = 0.5))
```

# Model Performance & Technical Architecture

:::::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### ARIMA Methodology

**Historical Data** → USGS flow records

**Pattern Recognition** → Seasonal + trend analysis  

**Forecast** → 7-day predictions

### Model Accuracy Exceeds Target

```{r accuracy-metrics, fig.width=6, fig.height=4, fig.cap="Figure 4. ARIMA model forecast accuracy performance across prediction horizons. Target accuracy threshold (80%) shown with dashed line (Bubulka, 2025)."}
# Create accuracy visualization
accuracy_data <- data.frame(
  timeframe = c("24-hour", "7-day"),
  accuracy = c(95, 82)
)

ggplot(accuracy_data, aes(x = timeframe)) +
  geom_col(aes(y = accuracy), fill = "#3498db", width = 0.6, alpha = 0.8) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 80, color = "#e74c3c", linetype = "dashed", size = 1) +
  geom_text(aes(y = accuracy, label = paste0(accuracy, "%")), 
            vjust = -0.5, size = 6, fontface = "bold", color = "#2c3e50") +
  labs(title = "Forecast Accuracy",
       x = "Horizon", y = "Accuracy (%)") +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 100), breaks = seq(0, 100, 20)) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank())
```

**Target: 80% ✓**
:::

# Model Validation Framework

## Upstream Validation Strategy

:::::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="60%"}
### Validation-Only Network

**Primary Prediction Target:**
- **USGS 01646500** - Little Falls, MD (ARIMA forecasts)
- **All predictions focus on Little Falls only**

**Validation Stations (No Predictions):**
- **USGS 01638500** - Point of Rocks, MD (upstream validation)
- **USGS 01646000** - Near Washington, DC (secondary validation)  
- **Purpose**: Real-time accuracy tracking and confidence scoring only

### Dashboard Integration
- **Prediction Panel**: Little Falls 7-day ARIMA forecasts
- **Validation Strip**: Upstream data for model confidence scoring
- **Confidence Indicator**: Dynamic accuracy percentage based on validation
- **Early Warning**: Upstream condition alerts (validation triggers only)
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
```{r validation-framework, fig.width=5, fig.height=6, fig.cap="Figure 6. Validation network showing Little Falls predictions validated against upstream flow data for real-time confidence scoring (Bubulka, 2025)."}
# Create validation flow diagram
validation_data <- data.frame(
  station = c("Point of Rocks\n(Validation)", "Washington DC\n(Validation)", "Little Falls\n(Predictions)"),
  x_pos = c(0.8, 1.2, 1),
  y_pos = c(3, 3, 1),
  station_type = c("Validation", "Validation", "Prediction")
)

ggplot(validation_data, aes(x = x_pos, y = y_pos)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = station_type), size = 8, alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("Prediction" = "#3498db", "Validation" = "#f39c12")) +
  geom_text(aes(label = station), hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5, 
            size = 3, fontface = "bold", color = "white") +
  geom_segment(aes(x = 0.8, y = 3, xend = 1, yend = 1.5), 
               arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.2, "cm")), 
               color = "#f39c12", size = 1.5, linetype = "dashed") +
  geom_segment(aes(x = 1.2, y = 3, xend = 1, yend = 1.5), 
               arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.2, "cm")), 
               color = "#f39c12", size = 1.5, linetype = "dashed") +
  annotate("text", x = 0.7, y = 2, label = "Validation\nData Only", 
           size = 3, color = "#f39c12", fontface = "italic") +
  annotate("text", x = 1.3, y = 2, label = "Validation\nData Only", 
           size = 3, color = "#f39c12", fontface = "italic") +
  annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0.5, label = "ARIMA Predictions", 
           size = 3.5, color = "#3498db", fontface = "bold") +
  xlim(0.5, 1.5) +
  ylim(0, 3.5) +
  labs(title = "Validation-Only Network") +
  theme_void() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
        legend.position = "none")
```

**Clear Separation:**
- **Blue**: Prediction target (Little Falls)
- **Orange**: Validation only (upstream stations)
- **Dashed Lines**: Validation data flow (not predictions)
- **Purpose**: Model confidence, not additional forecasts
:::
::::::

# Technical Architecture

```{r tech-architecture, fig.width=10, fig.height=8, fig.cap="Figure 5. System architecture flow diagram showing data processing pipeline from USGS source to user interface (Bubulka, 2025)."}
# Create vertical system architecture flow diagram
arch_data <- data.frame(
  component = c("USGS\nData", "Data\nIngestion", "ARIMA\nEngine", "Safety\nLogic", "Dashboard\nUI"),
  x = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 1),
  y = c(5, 4, 3, 2, 1)
)

ggplot(arch_data, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = x - 0.4, xmax = x + 0.4, ymin = y - 0.3, ymax = y + 0.3),
            fill = "#ecf0f1", color = "#3498db", size = 2) +
  geom_text(aes(label = component), size = 4, fontface = "bold") +
  
  # Add vertical arrows
  annotate("segment", x = 1, xend = 1, y = 4.7, yend = 4.3,
           arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.3, "cm")), size = 1.5, color = "#3498db") +
  annotate("segment", x = 1, xend = 1, y = 3.7, yend = 3.3,
           arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.3, "cm")), size = 1.5, color = "#3498db") +
  annotate("segment", x = 1, xend = 1, y = 2.7, yend = 2.3,
           arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.3, "cm")), size = 1.5, color = "#3498db") +
  annotate("segment", x = 1, xend = 1, y = 1.7, yend = 1.3,
           arrow = arrow(length = unit(0.3, "cm")), size = 1.5, color = "#3498db") +
  
  labs(title = "Data Processing Pipeline") +
  xlim(0.3, 1.7) + ylim(0.5, 5.5) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5))
```

  stage = c("Better\nDecisions", "Fewer\nRescues", "Safer\nCommunity"),
  x = c(2, 6, 10),

  geom_point(size = 30, color = "#3498db", alpha = 0.3) +
